p: Viral titres of infected CRFK cells treated with TEO and of untreated infected cells (virus control) were expressed as the log10 TCID 50/50 μl and plotted against the drug concentrations. By comparing the viral titre of untreated infected cells (4.25 log10 TCID 50/50 μl) with infected cells treated with TEO at 13.5 and 27 μg/ml, a decrease of 0.25 ( p > 0.05) and 2.25 log10 TCID 50/50 μl ( p < 0.0001), respectively was induced ( Fig. 1A). This suggests that TEO at 27 μg/ml is able to significantly inhibit virus replication. The antiviral activity of TEO against FIPV parallels results obtained with Thymus vulgaris hydrosols in vitro against Porcine Reproductive and Respiratory Syndrome virus (PRRSV) ( Kaewprom et al., 2017).
